Mono valued parameters - Those parameter.description:
Final status in which the change Request will be after acceptance.

Possible values:
  • pending deployment
  • deployed

examples.title: Example usage:
examples.content:
// Update display name: 
curl -H "X-API-Token: yourToken" -X POST http://rudder.example.com/rudder/api/latest/changeRequests/42/accept -d "status=deployed"

examples.title: Success-Response:
Success-Response:
Success-Response:

Mono valued parameters - Those parameter.description:
The status of change requests you want to display.

Possible values:
  • pending validation
  • pending deployment
  • cancelled
  • deployed
  • open (pending validation + pending deployment)
  • closed (cancelled + deployed)
  • all

examples.title: Success-Response:
Example usage:
examples.content:
// Update display name: 
curl -H "X-API-Token: yourToken" -X POST http://rudder.example.com/rudder/api/latest/changeRequests/42  -d "name=new Name of Change Request" -d "description=add a new description"

version as source] Define the technique version used. By default it will used the version of the cloned Directive

Technique version] In which version your tehcnique should be created.

title: 11. Update a Group Category
name: updateGroupCategory
description: Modify any parameters of a Group category. Missing parameters means to not modify that parameter

Multi valued parameters - Those paramete.description: Level of information to include from the node inventory. Some base levels are defined (minimal, default, full). You can add fields you want to a base level by adding them to the list, possible values are keys from json answer. If you don't provide a base level, they will be added to default base level, so if you only want os details, use "minimal,os" as the value for this parameter

examples.title: Success-Response:
Error-Response:

title: 1. List accepted Nodes
name: listAcceptedNodes
description: That function allow you to get details of accepted Nodes. You can make query on those Nodes based on inventory criterion. You can use the same queries than those used in NodeGroup queries

Multi valued parameters - Those paramete.description: Level of information to include from the node inventory. Some base levels are defined (minimal, default, full). You can add fields you want to a base level by adding them to the list, possible values are keys from json answer. If you don't provide a base level, they will be added to default base level, so if you only want os details, use "minimal,os" as the value for this parameter

Query parameters - Those parameters will.description: A query json object like we use as query in NodeGroups. A three field json object { 'composition' : 'and', 'select' : 'node', 'where' : [{"objectType":"node","attribute":"OS","comparator":"eq","value":"Linux"}]}, That parameter can be replaced by the three following (select, composition, where)
The criterion you want to find for your nodes like '[{"objectType":"node","attribute":"OS","comparator":"eq","value":"Linux"}]}'
Boolean operator to use between each criteria. Other value is "And". Only used if 'where' is defined.
What kind of data we want to include. Here we can get policy servers/relay by setting 'nodeAndPolicyServer'. Only used if where is defined.

examples.title: Example usage (curl):
examples.content:
# Get all nodes having a hostname starting with node1 and based on Linux
curl -H "X-API-Token: yourToken" 'https://rudder.example.com/rudder/api/latest/nodes?where=\[\{"objectType":"node","attribute":"OS","comparator":"eq","value":"Linux"\},\{"objectType":"node","attribute":"nodeHostname","comparator":"regex","value":"node1.*"\}\]'

examples.title: Example usage (python-requests):
Success Response (curl):

Multi valued parameters - Those paramete.description: Level of information to include from the node inventory. Some base levels are defined (minimal, default, full). You can add fields you want to a base level by adding them to the list, possible values are keys from json answer. If you don't provide a base level, they will be added to default base level, so if you only want os details, use "minimal,os" as the value for this parameter

title: 5. Set Node properties
name: updateNodeProperties

Multi valued parameters - Those paramete.description: A property of the Node defined by its name and its value.

description: This API allows to set "key=value" properties in node. This properties are then returned in the node details under the "properties" key, and they can be used to define group. Value are non-empty UTF-8 strings. Setting a key to the empty string removes it from the list of properties for that node.

examples.title: Initial content
Set key
examples.content:
# Setting keys from "properties.json":
curl -H "X-API-Token: yourToken" -X POST  -H "Content-Type: application/json" https://rudder.example.com/rudder/api/latest/nodes/NodeID -d @properties.json

examples.title: Remove key
examples.content:
# Removing the key "utf-8 poetry" from the command line and updating the "env_type" one:
curl -H "X-API-Token: yourToken" -X POST  -H "Content-Type: application/json" https://rudder.example.com/rudder/api/latest/nodes/NodeID -d '{ "properties": [{ "name":"utf-8 poetry", "value":""}, {"name":"env_type", "value":"deprovisioned"}] }'

examples.title: Remove key (bis)
examples.content:
# Removing the key "env_type" and changing "shell" (no JSON):
curl -H "X-API-Token: yourToken" -X POST  https://rudder.example.com/rudder/api/latest/nodes/NodeID -d "properties=shell=/bin/false" -d "properties=env_type="

examples.title: Success-Response:

Mono valued parameters - Those parameter.description: The value can be overidden by Node Parameter (not existing in 2.7)

examples.title: Success-Response:
Error-Response:
examples.content:
HTTP/1.1 500 Server Error
{
  "action": "deleteParameter",
  "id": "rudder_file_edit_footer",
  "result": "error",
  "errorDetails": "Could not delete Parameter rudder_file_edit_footer cause is: Could not find Parameter rudder_file_edit_footer."
}

examples.title: Success-Response:

title: 6. Clone a Rule
name: cloneRule
description: Create a new Rule based on an existing Rule. you can still modify its parameters, but you need at least to specify the name of the new Rule

Mono valued parameters - Those parameter.description: ID of the Rule the clone will be based onto. if this parameter is missing there will be only a Rule creation.
Define the id of the Rule to create, Rudder will generate an id if this is missing. You should only use it for specific use case.

enabled the Rule at creation. But this parameter can be overriden : if you want to create Rule with directives and Rule targets directly with workflow enabled, the Rule will be created disabled (to prevent creating active Rule without validation).

Multi valued parameters - Those paramete.description: link one directive to the Rule. value needs to be an existing directive ID.
Link one target to the Rule. Rule targets are "group:groupId" and the special targets : "special:all" and "special:all_exceptPolicyServers".

examples.title: Example usage:
examples.content: curl -H "X-API-Token: yourToken" -X PUT 'http://rudder.example.com/rudder/api/latest/rules?prettify=true'  -d "source=RuleIDSource" -d "displayName=Name of New Rule”

enabled the Rule at creation. But this parameter can be overriden : if you want to create Rule with directives and Rule targets directly with workflow enabled, the Rule will be created disabled (to prevent creating active Rule without validation).

Multi valued parameters - Those paramete.description: link one directive to the Rule. value needs to be an existing directive ID.
Link one target to the Rule. Rule targets are "group:groupId" and the special targets : "special:all" and "special:all_exceptPolicyServers".
